Nested Class Summary
 class BillingManagerImpl.RequestPurchase
          This request sends a purchase message to the Google Play app and is the foundation of in-app billing.
 class BillingManagerImpl.RestoreTransactions
          This request retrieves a user's transaction status for managed purchases.

checkResponseCode

public void checkResponseCode(long requestId,
                              BillingResponseCode responseCode)
Description copied from interface: BillingManager
This is called when we receive a response code from the Google Play app for a request that we made. This is used for reporting various errors and for acknowledging that an order was sent to the server. This is NOT used for any purchase state changes. All purchase state changes are received in the BillingReceiver and passed to this service, where they are handled in BillingManager.purchaseStateChanged(String, String).

Specified by:
checkResponseCode in interface BillingManager
Parameters:
requestId - a number that identifies a request, assigned at the time the request was made to the Google Play app
responseCode - a response code from the Google Play app to indicate the state of the request
See Also:
BillingManager.checkResponseCode(long, com.jdroid.android.billing.BillingResponseCode)

checkBillingSupported

public boolean checkBillingSupported()
Description copied from interface: BillingManager
Checks if in-app billing is supported.

Specified by:
checkBillingSupported in interface BillingManager
Returns:
false if there was an error connecting the Google Play app
See Also:
BillingManager.checkBillingSupported()

requestPurchase

public boolean requestPurchase(Purchasable purchasable,
                               String developerPayload)
Description copied from interface: BillingManager
Requests that the given item be offered to the user for purchase. When the purchase succeeds (or is canceled) the BillingReceiver receives an intent with the action BillingReceiver.ACTION_NOTIFY. Returns false if there was an error trying to connect to the Google Play app.

Specified by:
requestPurchase in interface BillingManager
Parameters:
purchasable - the product to purchase
developerPayload - a payload that is associated with a given purchase, if null, no payload is sent
Returns:
false if there was an error connecting to the Google Play app
See Also:
BillingManager.requestPurchase(com.jdroid.android.billing.Purchasable, java.lang.String)

restoreTransactions

public boolean restoreTransactions()
Description copied from interface: BillingManager
Requests transaction information for all managed items. Call this only when the application is first installed or after a database wipe. Do NOT call this every time the application starts up.

Specified by:
restoreTransactions in interface BillingManager
Returns:
false if there was an error connecting to the Google Play app
See Also:
BillingManager.restoreTransactions()

confirmNotifications

public boolean confirmNotifications(String... notifyIds)
Description copied from interface: BillingManager
Confirms receipt of a purchase state change. Each notifyId is an opaque identifier that came from the server. This method sends those identifiers back to the MarketBillingService, which ACKs them to the server. Returns false if there was an error trying to connect to the MarketBillingService.

Specified by:
confirmNotifications in interface BillingManager
Parameters:
notifyIds - a list of opaque identifiers associated with purchase state changes.
Returns:
false if there was an error connecting to the Google Play app
See Also:
BillingManager.confirmNotifications(java.lang.String[])

getPurchaseInformation

public boolean getPurchaseInformation(String[] notifyIds)
Description copied from interface: BillingManager
Gets the purchase information. This message includes a list of notification IDs sent to us by the Google Play app, which we include in our request. The server responds with the purchase information, encoded as a JSON string, and sends that to the BillingReceiver in an intent with the action BillingReceiver.ACTION_PURCHASE_STATE_CHANGED. Returns false if there was an error trying to connect to the MarketBillingService.

Specified by:
getPurchaseInformation in interface BillingManager
Parameters:
notifyIds - a list of opaque identifiers associated with purchase state changes
Returns:
false if there was an error connecting to the Google Play app
See Also:
BillingManager.getPurchaseInformation(java.lang.String[])

purchaseStateChanged

public void purchaseStateChanged(String signedData,
                                 String signature)
Description copied from interface: BillingManager
Verifies that the data was signed with the given signature, and calls BillingListener.onPurchased(PurchaseOrder), BillingListener.onRefunded(PurchaseOrder) or BillingListener.onCanceled(PurchaseOrder) for each verified purchase.

Specified by:
purchaseStateChanged in interface BillingManager
Parameters:
signedData - the signed JSON string (signed, not encrypted)
signature - the signature for the data, signed with the private key
See Also:
BillingManager.purchaseStateChanged(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

onServiceConnected

public void onServiceConnected(android.content.ComponentName name,
                               android.os.IBinder binder)
This is called when we are connected to the MarketBillingService. This runs in the main UI thread.

unbind

public void unbind()
Description copied from interface: BillingManager
Unbinds from the MarketBillingService. Call this when the application terminates to avoid leaking a ServiceConnection.

Specified by:
unbind in interface BillingManager
